reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book got my attention within the first couple of pages. Was such a good read! I'm just now getting into books and I bought this book for my first read and I could not put it down! It was so good! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Having just gone through the Christmas season this read hit spot on. This was my introduction to this author. I enjoyed the book and read it quickly. The story grabbed my interest within the first page and kept it throughout. The setting just added to the story, it was the perfect package for a creepy Christmas thriller. My main con is the author repeated…. A lot! It wasn’t chapters or even pages apart either it was sentences apart that she wrote almost word for word what she’d just written. Just a pet peeve of mine and probably not noticeable to most. It didn’t hinder the story at all just an fyi for those who find things like that annoying. Anyway… I’ll be reading more from this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It was very good,ila twist at the end that you saw coming but didn't.Highly recommend!!.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not her best work
reviews.reviewText: While the plot was intriguing the book was drawn out with aimless filler . The conclusion was beyond ridiculous . I am a fan of this author but this is by far not her best work

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The Girl Who Survived catches you right from the beginning. It moved on and makes you feel like your right there. It gets your heart pumping. I would recommend this to anyone that enjoys a good murder mystery. Can’t wait to read move of Lisa Jackson.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Trust no one
reviews.reviewText: 4 who done it stars!This is a good book with a ton of twists and turns. I had no clue who to trust and definitely no idea who was the ravenous murderer.The book was unique in the way it was laid out. I enjoyed the characters very much. I actually trusted zero of them. Even Kara at one point. The relationships between characters were relatable and drew you in.Though I think the middle kind of lost me for a minute. The re-telling of the famous night gets a little old after a while. Then some weird stuff happened near the end and I was like wth for a moment. Almost a little unbelievable and rushed at some point. I feel like this had the makings of a 5🌟 book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Started out slow but actually got better and better as the chapters went on. Loved the twists and turns in the last half of the book. Recommend the read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book had me on the edge of my seat the whole time. Just when I thought I had it figured out, something new would change my mind. I just couldn’t put it down. Thank you Lisa Jackson!

I loved this book. Kara saw the results of her family massacre. Her life is turned upside down. She bravely kept going when Jonas was free from jail. Then all he'll breaks loose again. This is a real nailbitter.

Plot ziemlich weit hergeholt und unschlüssig mit unglaubwürdigem Ende. Psychologie und Motive des Täters und Beteiligten wenig plausibel. Überhaupt bleiben die Personen blass. Stattdessen seitenlanges uninteressantes Füllmaterial, z.B was die Nachrichten gerade bringen während der Cop im Keller über 40 minutenlang trainiert. Wiederholungen, als hätte Autor vergessen, dass sie das nur kurz vorher schon beschrieben hatte. (Z.B. denkt Protagonistin darüber nach, dass sie nicht weiß, wann sie zuletzt was zu essen hatte außer Käse und cracker um kurz darauf wieder die genau dasselbe zu denken, als der Lieferdienst endlich kommt). Das ist schlicht nervig, langweilig und lässt einen fragen, ob es überhaupt sowas wie Beta-reader, geschweige denn ein Lektorat gegeben hat. Die Kindle-Version der englischen Fassung ist zudem durchsetzt von falschen (wahrscheinlich manuell gesetzten) Seitenumbrüchen und Worttrennungen, was den Lesefluss definiert stört durch die ungewollten Absätze, die so entstehen. Scheint generell ein Problem zu sein bei digitalen Kindle Fassungen. Kann mal bitte eine Schulung an Autoren rausgehen über Text Formatierung? !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: never read this author's work before but enjoyed the style and format and the story was good, kept you engaged throughout

reviews.reviewTitle: it was okay read, not as good as some of her others.
reviews.reviewText: It did not keep me captivated. By the middle of the story I was able to guess who the killer was.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 21, 2023
